thread.title: Angry Katie Price takes a swipe at ex Dwight Yorke over son Harvey after he's denied entry to USA
thread.title_full: Angry Katie Price takes a swipe at ex Dwight Yorke over son Harvey after he's denied entry to USA

author: Lara Martin
title: Angry Katie Price takes a swipe at ex Dwight Yorke over son Harvey after he's denied entry to USA
text:
Angry Katie Price takes a swipe at ex Dwight Yorke over son Harvey after he's denied entry to USA Furious Katie has accused the Manchester United legend of failing to visit his teenage son Harvey Share Katie Price hits back at Dwight Yorke   
Katie Price has taken a swipe at her ex-boyfriend Dwight Yorke after he claimed to have been denied access to the US . 
The former glamour model accused Dwight of being able to fly to the US but not come to her home in West Sussex to visit their son Harvey, 14, 
An angry Katie tweeted: “Why don’t you get a flight to West Sussex and see your son Harvey. He has only been waiting 10 years… you know the four is always open #d**k (sic)” Katie isn't happy with Dwight (Photo: Twitter) Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Share this video Watch Next 
And just in case anybody didn’t know what she was talking about, Katie, 36, included a link to the story about Dwight’s travel woes. 
It’s not the first time Katie has laid into former Manchester United and England player Dwight, who is the father of her eldest son Harvey, born on May 27, 2002. 
Katie has previously accused ex-boyfriend Dwight of not seeing their child, who suffers from a range of disabilities including Prader-Willi syndrome and visual impairment. Dwight Yorke and Katie Price pictured in 2001 (Photo: Clive Mason/ALLSPORT) 
In her last autobiography, she wrote: "It’s sad that [Dwight] is unable to accept Harvey for who he is and seems unable or unwilling to work within his limitations. 
"I think Dwight wanted to blame someone for the fact that his son is disabled. I have always said that if Dwight could see what a courageous and talented boy Harvey is then he would enjoy being with him so much." 
In 2009, he told BBC Radio 5: "I would like to play an integral part in his upbringing, of course, I love my kid but wasn't given the opportunity to really bring him up in the manner I would like to bring him up in." 
Dwight has yet to respond to Katie’s latest tweet. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Moment Trump signs his shocking travel ban order Share this video Watch Next 
The footballer hit headlines overnight when he claimed to have been preventing from entering the USA due to an Iranian stamp on his passport. 
It came from when he represented World Stars in a charity match against the Iranian Stars which took place in Tehran two years ago. 
Dwight, 45, told The Sun : "I couldn't quite believe what was happening. I have lost count of the number of times I have been to America, I love the country, yet I was being made to feel like a criminal. 
"I had bought my ticket and checked in and was about to get on the flight when I was stopped by two officials. I thought 'what is happening here?’. Katie with son Harvey in 2016 (Photo: Rex Features) 
"They told me there was a visa problem and a red flag had come up against my name because of an Iranian stamp in my passport. I went there to play in a legends match to open a stadium and didn't even stay overnight. 
"The two officials told me if I got on the flight I would simply be deported back to Qatar once I arrived in the States. I tried to explain I didn't even live in Qatar and was just trying to get to my home in the Caribbean." 
Dwight’s woes came a month after President Donald Trump signed an executive order temporarily banning individuals from Iran, Iraq, Somalia, Sudan, Syria and Yemen from entering the USA. Like us on Facebook
